title: LOVE VARO
review:
Best bank ever. They treat me like I matter. I‚Äôll always tell others how awesome VARO is. I gave up on banks along time ago. Until my friend told me about VARO. I decided to give it a shot and I am beyond pleased. I am Thankful for VARO, and being able to have an actual debit card and not have it be ‚Äúlooked‚Äù at like it‚Äôs a prepaid debit card. I like to use apps to pay and most do not support pre paid debit cards. So I would always run into problems. Not anymore thanks to VARO. THANK YOU VARO!! 
VARO ROCKS!!!!!

title: You don‚Äôt post two days early
review:
You are a lying sack of dog crap. everyone got paid except me and yet you here saying that I get paid two days early. when are you gonna understand that you online banks are not good without the 2 day early feature. If I wanted to get my money on the payday I would have left it at Bank of America. The point of switching to varo was the two days early feature. I will be changing my direct deposit back to Bank of America and closing my varo account.

You have no ATMS no branches no way to deposit cash.  Without that get paid feature you‚Äôre useless to me. If I‚Äôm not gonna get my money early then I rather keep it with Bank of America. Adios varo
developerResponse: {'id': 19395374, 'body': 'The timing depends on your employer. Sometimes, that could mean they sent their payroll file on a later date and/or time than last time. So, if it takes longer than last time for your deposit to hit your account, it means your employer sent payroll files to the Fed later than last time. As a result, we get the files later too. Rest assured, we will release the funds as soon as we receive them. The timing can be inconsistent, there is nothing wrong with our system! \n\nAs for cash deposits, you can deposit cash into your Varo Bank Account at 90,000+ retail locations nationwide using Green Dot Reload @ the Register! Retail service fee applies.', 'modified': '2020-11-27T15:01:06Z'}

review:

Now that it‚Äôs Varo Bank, suddenly, no early deposit. Coincidence?? The only reason I have these online accounts is for that feature. Might as well just get my entire deposits going to my BMO Harris accounts.

Edit: This has been resolved.
Thanks Varo team.

title: No problems

title: So far so good
review:
I‚Äôve been on Varo for over a year now, and so far so good. I get my direct deposits several days early. Occasionally like any startup there are occasional inconveniences, and technical glitches but their customer service has done well in terms of communicating with customers.

Being able to call customer service, and getting a human on the other end of the line is exactly what I want at all times when it comes to my money so Varo does well on that end.

title: Good app
review: This app and the website are very slick. Something I would like to see on the app is how on the website the debits and credits are separated by date. This makes it easier to view transactions but on the phone app everything blends in together. Also, need to be able to link Plaid to Varo through other apps. Now that Varo is a ‚Äúreal‚Äù FDIC insured bank there should be some type of bill pay, checks, and maybe credit cards. But all in due time.

I switched to this bank solely because, at the time, they were the only bank with a widget which displayed your balance and I found it incredibly useful. I‚Äôve reached out to support on Twitter, phone and email and have received no help or fix. 

I‚Äôll be switching soon as there are now many more banks with a balance widget.

You would think such a small niche bank would prioritize its technical features, why else use them?

I also really love that they help you to save your change and will also take a portion of your paycheck to send to your savings!

title: Rebuilding bad credit
review: Due to my past and a series of unfortunate events my credit has takin a serious hit, opening a checking/debit account seemed impossible until I found Varo. Plenty of atm‚Äôs with no fees and plenty of stores to reload my account makes it seem a little less impossible. Thanks to Varo I am able to have banking available even with my checkered credit issues!!

title: The app is too zoomed in.

When I click on activate card I am unable to scroll down towards where the app wants me to. And most frustrating of all is that when I try to go into the actual Varo site to see if I could get it done there like the ild days used to work, it sends me right back to the app. Please fix the overly zoomed in app. I might wear glasses, but I‚Äôm not that blind lol. review: As of March 31st, varo has closed down thousands of people bank accounts with no warning or explanation. We all had money in the account and now have to wait weeks to get our money back. title: This Is How Banking Should Be!!!
review: I have been using Varo for about two years and I am highly satisfied. They are new but give them time to get even better. What‚Äôs great is you have no overdraft fees in the first 30 days, that‚Äôs awesome. Some times in my life I hit a rough patch and lost track of payments, overdraft fees hitting me the second I go negative, Varo gives you 30 days to bring it positive :) and the customer service has been GREAT

title: Amazing but a few things lacking
review:
This has been an amazing bank. Been with them since they were just Varo money. Constantly working to make the best experience 

What needs to happen is a Joint account option for married couples.

A goal section that you could set aside money into a sub category of your savings could help you save but also learn budgeting. I hope this finds the developers, as I have been asking for some time!

title: Great app.
review: I‚Äôve been loyal to varo, and I have no complaints. The app is amazing it‚Äôs simple, so easy to use and everything is literally at your finger tips. I love having the option to have the savings and checking account most banks would have not approved me due to credit issues but varo gives you the chance to save with dignity and that is something I can fall behind anytime!

title: Responsive Customer Service‚Ä¶ if you make enough noise
review:
I wrote a scathing condemnation earlier about Varo earlier due to a string of glitches that caused half a dozen bounced eChecks/ACH transfers.

Since then, customer support has recovered both the initially lost funds and paid reparations for the return debit fees. It took not only that previous review but more serious and official complaint forms but in the end there was a timely response and reparations were paid.

I won‚Äôt give 5 stars immediately as I‚Äôm still wary of using Varo as my ACH transfer hub now and will tread carefully over the coming months. However, the fact that funds were recovered in a timely manner means for now I‚Äôll give the bank the benefit of the doubt.

Varo, you‚Äôre on thin ice right now but as long as you don‚Äôt mess up again, I may be able to offer a more positive review in the future.
developerResponse: {'id': 23346478, 'body': 'Hello! We are happy to hear that we were able to resolve your concern. We want you to know that our #1 goal is to ensure you have an excellent mobile banking experience. We are sorry if at any point we fell short of that. We look forward to improving your review further and thank you for the kind words.', 'modified': '2021-06-12T23:10:01Z'}

title: Great service and great APR rate. Slow transfers
review: I really really love Varo. I took my other savings account and nearly closed it to out the money here. Cant beat the APR rate. I also love that the app texts me every time I use my debit card for a purchase. My only frustration is how long transfers from my outside bank take. They say 1-4 business days but it was definitely 4. And the phone wait times are relentless and you can‚Äôt ever get hold of someone. Still, I recommend this bank.

title: No problems at all had varo for 2 and half years
review:
Even when they changed from a partner bank to their own bank , no flaws ans was seamless . Couldn‚Äôt be happier . I could get a local bank , but I would
Rather use varo , direct deposit , and the four dollars it cost to add money , is worth it when figuring maintenance fees and other fees with other banks .  Hands down the best option for me .

title: Best bank I've ever had!
review: I highly recommend this fintech bank. The only fees that I've seen seen were if you use an out of network atm. But, they have ten of thousands of in-network atms.. no monthly fees. And, once you get a little established with them, they offer you up to $100 before you get paid, interest free! What major brick and mortar bank you know of does that? None. #Plsstayawesomevaro

title: My Take on Varo
review: I have have a very great experience with Varo this far. I must say however, since becoming a chartered back there has been a few system and transaction glitches that should definitely not go unnoticed. Other than that, keep up the great work! developerResponse:
{'id': 19658606, 'body': "We are sorry to hear that you feel this way. Varo is the first fintech to receive a national banking charter. This allowed us to open Varo Bank! Varo Money accounts are provided by The Bancorp Bank, but with Varo Bank, accounts are now provided by us. This is the reason for the new Varo Bank app. We created a process to ensure that the migration process from Varo Money to Varo Bank would be as seamless as possible and apologize that this was not the case for you. 

We post deposits as soon as they are received. If you are not seeing the deposit in your account yet, then this means that we have not received it yet either. Be sure to have your notifications enabled so that you'll be notified when it hits! If you have transferred money using your Varo routing and account numbers, it can take 1-4 business days for the transfer to post. 

If you need further assistance, don't hesitate to reach out to us at 877-377-8276 (Mon‚ÄìFri: 8AM ‚Äì 9PM. ET, Sat‚ÄìSun:11AM ‚Äì 7PM ET, closed federal holidays) or email us at support@varomoney.com. 
", 'modified': '2020-12-10T02:06:35Z'}

title: Misleading interest rates
review:
There is some problem with interest algorithm or Varo bank is misleading people. I receive 0.2% interest for almost 20 days. In those 20 days I have received two qualifying direct deposit and used the debit card 5 times. On 25 the day you will receive an email from Varo that you will get 3% APY. For last 5 days of the month, I was receiving 3 % APY. But in the next month it resets back to 0.2 %. This cycle keeps repeating. You get high interest  only for  a week.
Last year I was happy with their service but now I am thinking of switching to some other bank.

title: Best banking app!

developerResponse: {'id': 20687953, 'body': "Hi there! Varo strictly follows federal regulations around transaction disputes and we use industry standards for researching and investigating claims. If you would like to report unauthorized transactions on your account, please reach out to our service team at help@varomoney.com, and we'd be happy to investigate.\n\nIn regards to direct deposits, the timing ultimately depends on your payer (your employer or a government agency). Sometimes, that could mean they sent their payroll file on a later date and/or time than last time. So, if it takes longer than last time for your deposit to hit your account, it means your employer sent payroll files to the Fed later than last time. As a result, we get the files later too. Rest assured, we will release the funds as soon as we receive them. We look forward to hearing from you!", 'modified': '2021-01-27T14:23:10Z'}

developerResponse: {'id': 19856375, 'body': "We're really sorry to hear you're upset about the switch to Varo Bank. title: Lock Card or Allow Transactions Toggle?
review: Haven‚Äôt used the app much but I‚Äôd like to see a ‚Äúlock/freeze card‚Äù option so if it‚Äôs lost or stolen or an option to ‚Äúturn off transactions‚Äù like Chime has.
developerResponse: {'id': 20194836, 'body': "We're happy to inform you of our card lock feature found right in the app! In order to use this feature, you'll need to: Log into the Varo App - Tap on\xa0Settings\xa0at the right of the bottom menu - In the\xa0Card Management\xa0section, find\xa0Lock your card\xa0under the image of the debit card. Slide the toggle to the right to lock or to the left to unlock. Locking your debit card helps prevent unauthorized purchases and withdrawals. Once your card is locked, it can‚Äôt be used to make in-store or online purchases, withdraw money from ATMs, or receive\xa0instant transfers\xa0from digital wallets like Paypal, Cash App, Uber or Lyft. Other types of transactions, like direct deposits, ACH transfers and bill payments, are not affected. If your card has been locked for two weeks or longer, contact Customer Service to unlock it at\xa0support@varomoney.com\xa0or 1-877-377-8276 (Monday - Friday, 8 AM to 9 PM Eastern Time and Saturday - Sunday, 11 AM to 7 PM Eastern Time, excluding federal holidays).", 'modified': '2021-01-05T14:38:43Z'}

If you have anymore questions and/or concerns, please feel free to contact our support team either by phone or email at support@varomoney.com. title: Varo has two apps ?
review: Why does varo have two apps ?
developerResponse: {'id': 18380649, 'body': "Great question! Varo is the first fintech to receive a national banking charter. This allowed us to open Varo Bank! The two apps you're seeing is Varo Money and Varo Bank. Varo Money accounts are provided by The Bancorp Bank, but with Varo Bank, accounts are now provided by us. Therefore, we're no longer taking applications for Varo Money but not to worry! You can apply for a Varo Bank account where we'll be continuously adding new features and improving the current ones with Varo Money. However, if you're already a current Varo Money customer, then hang tight as we'll be reaching out to you to let you know when it's your turn to transition to Varo Bank. The process will be as smooth and seamless as possible. All your transaction information and scheduled payments will be handled automatically! ", 'modified': '2020-10-09T14:59:13Z'}

title: So much taken away from old app and nothing better about this one.
review: This app is basically the exact same as the old varo money app, however there‚Äôs less to offer now then there used to be.  You can no longer mail checks to pay people or even get your own paper checks, which is frustrating because some of my bills haven‚Äôt got with the times and I can‚Äôt pay online.  There used to be a widget which was convenient and that‚Äôs gone as well.  The varo advance is also much worse if a service then the overdraw protection they used to have in my opinion.  You would think an online bank would have the best app since you have to do everything ‚ú®online‚ú®, but the app isn‚Äôt any better than other banks.  My other bank accounts have a feature to see your card digitally which makes online shopping way easier, it also would have made the transition way easier since we were forced to redo all of our existing subscriptions and what not with the new debit card number.  The only saving grace is the interest rate on the savings account, theirs is pretty much unbeatable.  However I can‚Äôt even use the save your pay feature because everytime I set it up it just resets back to 0%.  Overall not a pleasant experience going through the switch and having to use this mediocre app compared to the old one.  They really should have had a much better app in place and ready to go so it doesn‚Äôt feel like we went backwards.  Hopefully they can improve upon it and add some things that make them a truly good experience for an online bank.  Because right now you may as well just use a regular one.
developerResponse: {'id': 20112134, 'body': "We're really sorry to hear you're upset about the switch to Varo Bank. As we've just received our national banking charter, this enabled us to become a bank where we can now offer our own accounts along with other new and improved features. Varo Money accounts are provided by The Bancorp Bank so the switch is necessary and the debit cards are not interchangeable. However, we hear your frustrations and your feedback is taken very seriously as we know there is room for improvement. We're sorry that this experience has led you to consider banking elsewhere but please know that lots of new, great things are to come with Varo Bank. You can see the difference between Varo Bank and Varo Money here: https://www.varomoney.com/varobankmigration/ -- if you have any questions or further concerns for us, please reach out to us at appreview@varomoney.com! We're here and happy to help!", 'modified': '2020-12-31T18:35:39Z'}

title: Varo vs Traditional Brick & Mortar
review: I have been a Varo customer from the beginning when Varo had the orange starburst looking debit cards. I loved the fact that Varo paid the highest interest on money in your savings account. What doesn‚Äôt make sense is they significantly reduce that interest if you have more than 10k in your account. Last December 23rd or 24th there was a technical issue that prevented you from using your debit card for purchases. Without any notification from Varo I attempted to use my card to make a holiday purchase only to have my card declined. Fortunately I‚Äôm not the typical under banked customer that Varo provides service to, so I just used a different bank card. What was troubling to me was Varo never sent a notification warning me or its customers that your card might be declined due to technical issues. After I left the merchant I tried to call customer service but after over 20 minutes of unanswered calls I just gave up. It‚Äôs nice to get paid two days early even though I personally don‚Äôt need that benefit. I know that Chime and other Fintechs provide that service as well. My biggest issue is there is a limit of how much money you can transfer from Varo to an outside bank monthly. So if you meet that limit and need to get a large sum of cash, you have to go to a Walmart money center to get additional cash. The problem is the maximum you can get from the money center is $2000 per day. Here is where the traditional brick and mortar is beneficial. At the brick and mortar you have a personal banker that you can call or go see personally if you have any issues that have to be dealt with. With a Fintech you‚Äôre stuck trying to reach someone on the phone. Good luck reaching someone with Varo‚Äôs customer service department. My advice is to get an account with your local credit Union. If you have kids open a Varo account for them for their convenience since they probably won‚Äôt ever have the need to physically go to the bank. I still haven‚Äôt gotten the new Varo bank card and I was literally one of the original customers. Varo is still experiencing growing pains and will continue to do so as they are now officially a bank with their own charter. My personal banker called me the other day just to see if I needed anything. That‚Äôs a call you will never get from Varo. Your experience with Varo will be fine if you don‚Äôt have any real expectations of your bank to go above and beyond to provide a great user experience. I personally realized that Varo is a nice secondary or tertiary banking option.
developerResponse: {'id': 20712520, 'body': "We really appreciate you for taking the time to leave us your honest review! We're sorry that you're not satisfied with the switch to Varo Bank but know that we hear your frustrations and your feedback completely. There's always room for improvement and we'll be sure to run this back to the appropriate teams. Thank you!", 'modified': '2021-01-28T14:49:00Z'}

title: Can‚Äôt believe how easy and legit this is!
review:
First, I just wanna say KUDOS FOR MAKING AN ONLINE BANK OMG. I rarely leave reviews for apps, especially because most of the apps that I use don‚Äôt stand out to me as something I should review but anyhoo I had to do this. I have been with Wells Fargo ever since I moved to the United States and thought it was the best bank ever bc of their 24 hour customer service. (Obviously my standards are low) Anyhoo, 6 years later my savings account obviously didn‚Äôt acquire much interest bc A) I‚Äôm a student and B) their APY is 0.40% at best. 

Anyways, I‚Äôm so glad I stumbled upon this. This bank makes sense! I just signed up and I can‚Äôt wait to transfer my funds to build a savings account on here. I‚Äôm really happy with all the perks that is provided through this bank, the hassle free sign up, the no- minimum payment account creation, the no-overdraft fees and ofccc the high APY rate for savings account.

 I know it‚Äôs not traditional to use a bank like this but it beats these banking giants that have nothing to offer in comparison to what Varo offers. I am a CS major at Metro and I hope that I can work with you guys on the programming / developer side when I‚Äôm done with school. Really kudos with the app and everything you have done so far!!! üëè 

P.S. The app sometimes kicks you off when you‚Äôre using it, it did a Face ID scan and it kicked me off twice. 

Also, I was thinking that it might be more user friendly if you could automate the biometric scan on the login page for users who have opted-in for that option.

title: HORRIBLE IF I COULD GIVE NEGATIVE STARS I WOULD!
review: When you call the ‚Äúcustomer service phone number‚Äù it‚Äôs not a real bank like chase, hsbc, td. We know that but when you call any business that is advertising as a ‚ÄúBANK‚Äù you should not have to wait on hold to get someone on the phone for 5 hours a day which I have proof and pictures of. I already reported them to the BBB. When you email their ‚Äúcustomer support help email‚Äù they immediately respond with ‚Äúwe will get back to you in 2-5 business days‚Äù ? How in the world if I am trying to contact my bank that I have my hard working money in and they wanna tell me you won‚Äôt get back to me for a couple of days ? The help line doesn‚Äôt answer and when they do I asked for a manager they did not want to give me a manager they put a supervisor on the phone. I let him know that I was on hold for 5 hours and that it was an important matter, how I was not able to get in touch with my bank that is holding my money, not letting me sign in on the ‚Äúapp‚Äù and the supervisor proceeded to tell me it was irrelevant that I was on hold for so long, when I asked for his full name or at least his first name and his badge number employee number or supervisor number because I was disgusted with the service and disrespect from this business he proceeded to tell me ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have to give you any of that information, I only have to tell you my first name‚Äù. After trying to explain my situations, concerns and how upset I was to this ‚Äúsupervisor‚Äù on a fake phone line he then proceeded to hang ip on me. I have now been on the phone since 9 this morning have not gotten in touch with one single live person that has treated me with any type of decent respect. When you call a bank you should be asked normal questions to prove your identity such as your address your phone number even your social which they ‚Äúshould have‚Äù access too. The fact that it takes multiple hours, days to get in touch with someone where you have thousands of dollars sitting in a checking or savings account. I will stop at no end to continue to let people know how horrible this ‚Äúbusiness‚Äù is. Please stay away and please get yourself a real bank. You will never get on the phone or a response from anyone. Which we all should have known since it‚Äôs just a fake app on the App Store with no branch. So I guess it‚Äôs my fault for trying to trust in someone new. Please please save yourself the trouble and stay away from this retched ‚Äúbank‚Äù!

title: A lot worse than the old Varo Money!
review:
I have been using Varo Money (the old app) for about half a year and quite pleased with its services. Basically it fulfills all of its promises in terms of ease of use and great customer service. However, the new varo bank app is really a disappointment and few step backwards from the old one. I‚Äôll be blunt and say that the migration to this new app is an obvious inconvenience. I didn‚Äôt like that the company didn‚Äôt offer any apology and just act like they are doing us a favor claiming this is an upgrade. You would have to update your direct deposit at your workplace and all the autopay services that you are subscribing too. This process could take a long time because of the verification of the new account. That‚Äôs why they offer the 60 days to soften this hassle/annoyance, but claiming that it is an easy process and not owning this inconvenience to the customer is rather dishonest and non-transparent on their part. 
By the way, the activation of the new debit card is not that easy. You will get a new card delivered to your address you have on their file. The instructions say you can activate with the app or call the 1(877) numbers. I tried activating with the app which required to enter 4 last digits on the card and expiration date. It didn‚Äôt work. Tried like 5 times and gave up. Then I called the number, pressed ‚Äú2‚Äù to activate the card, followed the instructions and then was told to download the app to activate it. At this point, I feel like this is beyond stupidity. Why can‚Äôt they just stay as Varo Money? Now I need to deal with their customer service to activate the card and somehow Im already feeling this new card is not as reliable as the old one. I was thinking of using it on the holiday while traveling but now just to be safe, this card needs to prove it‚Äôs working fine before going with me anywhere.
I really hope this Varo Bank or whatever is not the beginning of the downfall for this company. Bottom line is that they have definitely been changed from good to worse. Just keep that in mind and try Ally or Chime if you‚Äôre new to online banking.

Update: called customer service as recommended to get card activated and was told that the migration is having some technical difficulty. So they couldn‚Äôt activate the card. Then I waited 4 more days and called again. Put on hold for more than 1 hour 30 minutes:( I gave up. Spent so much time solving this simple issue

We are a fast growing company and have recently been experiencing higher volumes than normal, but are working to quickly resolve this issue. ", 'modified': '2021-01-01T16:06:46Z'}

title: Nice but needs some work
review:
I have been using Varo for a couple of years now.  I like it ok.   There‚Äôs no ridiculous fees which is definitely a plus.  

Unfortunately I haven‚Äôt been all that impressed with the transition.   With Varo Money, fraud issues were much easier to dispute.  They were very intuitive. A few times they were already working on investigating suspicious purchases before I even noticed them.  I do prefer the simplicity of the older app too.   I get that it‚Äôs a whole  process but Varo Bank needs to do some work to get it together.  I do have a few pet peeves  though. 

1) I hate that in the new app I get the log out warning message EVERY SINGLE TIME I open it.  I get it, I was idle too long so it logged me out. But if I‚Äôm using FaceID just skip it and let me log in.  It‚Äôs a little aggravating.   

2) Also, there are times when I need to do mobile check deposits without a $2000 cap.  Mobile deposit should be convenient. That‚Äôs the point right?   It‚Äôs a pain to have to find a place to cash the check then pay 2 separate fees to load the max $1000 to my account. 

3) monthly bill pay would be a nice feature to have too. 

4) Customer service.  I can‚Äôt say if it‚Äôs good or bad cuz I can never get anyone on the phone.  I do mean never. Call when they open around 8ish and each time I was on hold for well over an hour.  No exaggeration.  It‚Äôs bizarre.  And I thought it was just me but I‚Äôve noticed other reviewers say the same thing.  And the email support is worse.  You get an auto reply when you submit a help ticket.  2 weeks ... that‚Äôs how long it took to get a real response.   I had forgotten that I emailed them.  

 Maybe I‚Äôm being too picky but I just need it to work better for me.   I really didn‚Äôt want to have 2 separate accounts but for now, I gotta hang onto Wells Fargo.

Thank you for your honest feedback, we sincerely appreciate it and will reach out to the necessary teams. If you have a concern about the limit you have for Mobile Check Deposit, please reach out to us at appreview@varomoney.com so we can look into that for you! ', 'modified': '2021-04-28T02:33:40Z'}

title: Cool bank, suddenly a little disappointed
review:
I‚Äôve been banking with Varo since they were Varo Money and their features are cool and the platform is easy to navigate. I do however have a problem with a sudden rule they have implemented.

So I joined for the high APY which is 2.8% (also you have to qualify to get your paycheck 2 days earlier as well if you care about that) if you meet the qualifications which are:
‚Ä¢ Have at least $0.01 in your account and less than $10,000
‚Ä¢ Make 5 qualifying purchases (buy things, no bank transfers or atm withdrawals)
‚Ä¢ Direct deposit of at least $1,000 per month

These are fair enough terms. However, they have done something kind of sneaky in my opinion. Instead of qualifying from statement to statement they now make you qualify every single month. As in, on the first day of every month your APY is automatically reset back to .4%. (and your paycheck also comes at the regular time until you qualify again, I believe)

They changed the terminology in January. Which means until you get paid (for some workers this is the 15th/30th) you may miss out on the 2.8% APY for the first 15 days. Also, until you make the qualifying purchases - I don‚Äôt think I personally am excited to go swipe my debit card 5 times on the first of every single month especially in a pandemic (and I LOVE shopping).

This isn‚Äôt a big deal as you still get the 2.8% APY for at least half the year, if you‚Äôre lucky enough to get a paycheck on the first of the month - sometimes longer, which is great if the terms are explained properly, but I believe it is just sneaky and disappointing as someone who liked this company and their perceived transparency. It seemed very misleading and I wanted to give others a heads up.

They are the one of the highest among savings accounts for sure which is a safe option but I think the deceitful nature of this has me ready to close the account, currently looking at other options. There are other options out there and I highly recommend searching for them before settling.

Otherwise great app, great services, great customer service -  e-mail wise they usually take 3-5 business days and I haven‚Äôt been on hold phone wise for longer than 30 minutes. (: 
Cheers and happy saving!
developerResponse: {'id': 20911419, 'body': 'Thank you for taking the time to leave us your honest review. We appreciate your feedback. To clarify, no qualifications are required to be met to be paid up to two days early. Here at Varo Bank, we post direct deposits as soon as we receive notification from the Federal Reserve. Therefore, if we receive word early then we will post your funds that early. Otherwise, you should not receive your deposit any later than your actual pay date. Regarding your concern with our elevated savings feature, you are correct. Your eligibility resets at the beginning of each month so you‚Äôll need to re-qualify for each new month. However, when you qualify for 2.80% APY, you will earn the higher rate for that entire calendar month, even if you only met the requirement on the last day of the Qualifying Period. To learn more, visit our FAQ page!', 'modified': '2021-02-08T01:02:23Z'}

title: If it‚Äôs not broken, don‚Äôt fix it.
review:
I miss the original Varo it was so much better.

I started Varo last year and I really enjoyed it. Getting my money was extremely simple, my direct deposits came early, and communicating with representatives wasn‚Äôt a hassle at all. I understand with the Stimulus payments there has been extremely high volumes, but I‚Äôve been calling for days at a time and never received a call back. It took me a week to get someone on the phone. Also, they never answer emails so don‚Äôt even bother. 

Don‚Äôt even get me started on the glitches on this app. Originally accessing everything was very self explanatory and easy, now it‚Äôs like a puzzle to find everything. The original routing and account numbers were very easy and worked almost everywhere and were very simple, and easy with direct deposit. These new routing and checking numbers do not work with every employer, and some places say it‚Äôs not a valid number. Don‚Äôt even think  about using it for direct deposit for any government assistance or benefits it won‚Äôt work. They say it‚Äôs not a valid number. If you‚Äôre transferring money for cash app it‚Äôs not instant. It‚Äôs takes 20-30 mins to show up. If you make purchases at a gas station or a convenient store Varo takes all your money out of your account and doesn‚Äôt show up until the next day.

I loved the original app it was quick, easy, convenient, and really helped me save. This new app is egregious. Please do not download it. You will have so many problems and they will take forever to fix them. It‚Äôs not worth it. I‚Äôm leaving them as of Friday, do not waste your time. And as for you Varo. If it‚Äôs not broken, don‚Äôt fix it. Learn to leave things the way they are, if they‚Äôre working efficiently.

As soon as we receive the funds from your employer, benefits provider, etc we post them to your account. It looks like you received assistance when calling in. title: They don‚Äôt care about you.
review:
New Update: My account has officially been closed and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. I am fortunate enough to not live paycheck to paycheck but my recent experience with Varo truly reinforces why I left. I made a mistake updating my direct deposit and did not save my changes so my paycheck was sent to the closed Varo account. Banks have 5 business days to return the funds to the ACH originator and Varo of course is taking the whole amount of time lol. In my first review, hold times were consistently 30-60 minutes but now they are consistently 60+ minutes. If I could market my hatred for this bank I would. 

Final Update: I submitted an account closure request yesterday by email and that was handled within a day. I submitted other requests by email and they were never handled and responded to a week later. I am glad to have made the choice to move from Varo. They do not deserve any loyalty. 

Update: As of today I still have not received any responses from my emails sent six days ago. Varo replied to my App Store review and said to contact them by email lol. Why would I do that if no one is going to respond. Officially working on switching now. Again, I love the platform but it‚Äôs not enough to keep me. 

I‚Äôve been with Varo since 2019 and have LOVED banking with them. I‚Äôm not sure when things changed but now they treat you just like any other bank, like an account number instead of a person. Hold times are always 30-60 minutes and they do not respond to emails. I expressed my concerns when I finally made it through to a rep and they just didn‚Äôt care, even when I mentioned I may be switching because of it. I have my Direct Deposit split between two banks but will be closing out my Varo account very soon. It really is unfortunate because I still love the platform but I just can‚Äôt support a startup who grew because of our loyalty and am now being slapped in the face.
developerResponse: {'id': 22029534, 'body': 'Thank you for taking time to provide your honest feedback. We are certainly sorry to see you go. However, we wish you the absolute best moving forward. Our team is currently escalating your situation and reviewing further. We appreciate your patience and cooperation.', 'modified': '2021-04-03T20:42:37Z'}

title: Zero Security, Zero Support
review:
I had two fraudulent/unauthorized transactions take place on my account this week that totaled $2000. Varo responded by disputing the claim and closing my account. I am extremely disturbed. 

Full story is below but to sum it up: 
The Varo product is seriously flawed. It enabled someone to hack into my account and transfer money to another Varo user. Rather then helping me reverse the fraud, Varo closed my account (implying I was responsible) and went completely silent despite multiple requests for further detail or assistance. 

This complete lack of security is troubling from a bank and I would strongly warn anyone against using them. 

Full story:

I‚Äôve had Varo since early 2020 and use it for savings. I‚Äôve never taken money out of the account or transferred money to another account. 

On 5/26 I noticed two Varo-to-Varo (‚ÄúV2V‚Äù) transactions post to my account totaling $2000, which is also the limit you can transfer. I did not initiate these transfers nor do I know the person the money was transferred to. 

I immediately called Varo and filed a claim. Two days later received a response saying that their investigation was complete and they found no error and my account was being irrevocably terminated.

I have had no luck with any follow up support and was told that the only thing to do was to send an email to their support line. So, instead of helping me with the illegal fraud on my account, they permanently closed my account and have refused to deal with the matter. 

Anticipating a canned response by Varo here and would ask them to please contact me instead.
developerResponse: {'id': 23082188, 'body': "It's always a difficult decision to close an account. We regularly verify financial activity to ensure we keep our whole community safe. In rare cases, it may be necessary to close an account in order to maintain the security and quality of our service. If you feel this decision was made in error, please reach out at support@varomoney.com.\r\n", 'modified': '2021-05-30T02:20:28Z'}

title: Love Varo
review: I have the other Varo app and account, just did the switch with no hassle, waiting for the card now.  Excited for the tap and pay feature as I can‚Äôt stand the chip. Also made sure that I updated my direct deposit information at work. Look forward to continuing to be a happy Varo customer for another year. Happy New Years everyone... updated 5/6/2021 What an amazing bank. I can absolutely count on it for early paydays and I had to use the advance and it came through for me in a time when I really really needed it. I am grateful to have found this bank.

title: Ended my business
review: They took my PPP loan even tho they let me put my money I make from my business in the account.I made it out the pandemic but Varo has ended my business.Never again will I do business with them they do not care about their customers.
developerResponse: {'id': 23003041, 'body': "Hi Deion, we're very sorry to hear of your situation. Varo Bank Accounts are for personal use only. We recommend contacting them for other options for receiving your business loan.", 'modified': '2021-05-25T13:39:06Z'}

title: Teresa H
review:
Been with Varo for a long time and always took care of my needs.The $100 advance a month helped to
pay my car payment. For some 
reason when we changed to this
new Varo I‚Äôm only getting $50 advance, but I‚Äôm sure I will be able
to get my $100 here soon??
Varo is so much better than any
otherl online bank I have ever used!

title: Perfect in every way expect 1 issue...
review: Absolutely love! Super quick, easy, well known by other apps, little to no extra fees, and simple yet includes all that a traditional bank account has. There‚Äôs just one slight issue that is a big enough issue to give it only 4 out 5 stars which is updating personal info. In order to just change/update your number, email or address it MUST be requested in writing from the original email the account was setup with abs attach a form of identification verification. All that should be fairly easy to do expect if you can‚Äôt get into the email account to send the request from then you probably have to call and once you get the email address updated still need to provide an ID or other option before just simply updating your contact number! Just seems a Little much to update your number. If they want that info then just require it when signing up but if you can access your account online or via app then allow people to update their Personal info on their own. Now I‚Äôm having to wait another day before they update my number which is a problem for me when I‚Äôm trying to this account to another account and can‚Äôt get the verification code bc they haven‚Äôt updated my number yet! Now I can‚Äôt access money for a total so far if 7 days! That‚Äôs annoying! But i still will use varo because the god definitely out weighs the single bad issue! GO VARO YOU ROCK!

title: About to close account
review: I am so frustrated with this app that I‚Äôm considering closing my account. I have been unable to access my account for about 2 weeks now and I don‚Äôt feel like any representative I spoke with is really helping. Randomly, one night after making a purchase with my Varo debit card, I tried to log in. However, the app wouldn‚Äôt allow me to do so because it says it doesn‚Äôt recognize my device. I have had my account for nearly 2 years now and been using the same device since December. I‚Äôve never had this issue until now. I have deleted and reinstalled the app, as recommended by a representative. I have requested a code be sent to my phone to verify my identity once an hour, as recommended by a representative. However, I haven‚Äôt received any one of those codes and I know for a fact my phone is on and my data is working. It is May 8th and I haven‚Äôt heard anything from anyone at this bank since May 3rd. This is ridiculous.
developerResponse: {'id': 22707171, 'body': "We're sorry to hear about your experience! We want to look into this ASAP for you, but we couldn't locate your account with your username. Please reach out to us at appreview@varomoney.com so we can assist!", 'modified': '2021-05-10T00:19:59Z'}

title: Unable to Fees My Kids Account Locked
review: I called Varo to see my child support deposit had been received. I forgot there was a security phrase on my account. My phone plan will not allow me to use the data while, I‚Äôm on the phone. I was unable to get the phrase out my email. I tried to download the my email to boyfriend unable to get the code get was sent to my email. I tried to log into my account the next day my account had been locked. I‚Äôve been told everyday fraud will send a email by end of business. It‚Äôs been 5 days NO. My child support as post now I can‚Äôt feed my son. Now I have tell my son No Food until the fraud department send a email. I have No fraudulent Transactions on my account.
developerResponse: {'id': 22680124, 'body': "We operate under banking laws and government regulations. At times, we may need to suspend an account if there‚Äôs something unusual occurring that‚Äôs in need of further verification. Our community's safety is our number one priority. Our team will be reaching out shortly. ", 'modified': '2021-05-07T13:31:02Z'}

title: Logging In
review: Ever since I‚Äôve made the change to the new Varo Bank app, Every-time I go to log in I have to enter a security code!? That becomes very inconvenient. I used to be able to use my face log in but now a code always has to be sent to my text and then I can log in!? Why?? Fix this issue PLEASE. The widget is useless because I‚Äôm always having to log in with a code being sent to my phone. Let us decide if we want that extra security! I would rather log in once with my password and then being able to use Face ID there after! This is ridiculous. Fix and I‚Äôll change to 5 star because other than that I have absolutely no issues! But just that one issue alone isn‚Äôt even worth 2 stars, I‚Äôm just being nice.

title: New terms as of April 26, 2021
review: Well I was very happy with Varo until I received an email about the changes that will be effective 4.26.2021. They will start charging fees when you get money from making purchases at a store which is over the counter cash withdrawal. It was nice while it lasted so I will move onto the competition
developerResponse: {'id': 22399437, 'body': 'Hi! We can assure you that there are no new fees and no fees for cashback at the point of sale such as the grocery store. We charge only one $2.50 fee for out-of-network ATM withdrawals which can be avoided by using one of 55,000+ fee-free Allpoint¬Æ worldwide ATMs. There‚Äôs no monthly fees, no minimum balance fees, and no foreign transaction fees. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this matter, feel free to send an email to support@varomoney.com! \r\n', 'modified': '2021-04-22T13:59:02Z'}

title: Horrible online financial institute!
review: I joined Varo Bank sometime in March.  I liked everything they had to offer, so much so that I got all my direct deposits set up to go to Varo. Then I set up all my auto pay bills to withdraw their payments from Varo. Then the red flags started.  I sent them a question about something via email and they took days to answer but when they replied, it was only to tell me something like I made a good choice joining them, etc. didn‚Äôt address my question and I had to re-send that email which never did get answered. I had a dispute to file so since it was a weekend I had no choice but to send them an email.  But it wasn‚Äôt long before I found out that the transaction I was disputing turned out to be legit so I re-sent the email and told them to forget what I sent, I didn‚Äôt need to dispute, etc.  no answers from them on it, so it didn‚Äôt concern me since I told them all was okay.  I have a few direct deposits since I‚Äôm a senior citizen and disabled.  They all went through but the last one, it went to the former bank.  So I went to deposit a mobile check to Varo.  This is when I found out they are trouble.  I kept getting errors on the mobile check.  (Mind you, I‚Äôm a pro when it comes to online banking and to get errors on a mobile check is unheard of from where I‚Äôve been!) It didn‚Äôt have the same name as was on my account.  (Yes it did).  It didn‚Äôt have the right date.  (Yes it did).  Other errors that made no sense so I can‚Äôt remember.  I tried two times and got different errors and you have a choice of retry or deposit anyway.  The second time I tapped deposit anyway.  It took two days then I got an email from them stating it was rejected!  So I set out to do it all over again, same routine, and after I tapped deposit again I was so sorry I did because what made me think it‚Äôd have a better outcome, and I‚Äôm already late with the auto pay bills expected to withdraw out of Varo, I was freaking out.  So I had to figure out how to get that check deposited somewhere else and fast!  I managed to do so and all ended up well regarding my bills.  But, while all this was happening?  I called them.  First call I was told the wait would be over 60 minutes but I waited anyway, just set the phone down on speaker.  I waited for more than three hours before I hung up.  Called right back and waited two hours no answer.  Called again but didn‚Äôt make it an hour.  I don‚Äôt think they ever bother to answer their phone.  To this date they‚Äôve never answered my multiple emails on the subject and the emails were sent out on 04-11-21.  Today is 04-18-21.  I decided if they have no customer service for emergencies either by phone or email, I‚Äôm getting out of there right now.  And I did.  It was a lot of work but I had to re-direct my direct deposits and my auto pay bills to get out of Varo.  I would stay away from this so called financial business.  I‚Äôve heard other horror stories about them but I won‚Äôt get into them.  And I‚Äôd also give them a 0 star if I could.
developerResponse: {'id': 22354329, 'body': "Hi there! We're very sorry to hear your experience with Varo was less than satisfactory. Nonetheless, we appreciate the honest feedback! We‚Äôre currently experiencing extremely high volumes. We understand the importance of contacting customer support and are eager to assist with your request. We appreciate your patience during this time. Please contact us at appreview@varomoney.com so we can properly assist you!\r\n", 'modified': '2021-04-20T13:54:12Z'}

title: Varo, has not disappointed in 4 years
review:
So yeah I have been using Varo since 2017 and I can finally say that I have pretty much had the opportunity (or misfortune depending on the circumstance) to put them to the test in just about every way that matters... most recently I had a quite large
and bizarre  unauthorized transaction from a rental car company for over $3000.00 post to my account making it negative over $2000. Now i have not rented a car in over a year and I have never rented from this particular company...  I quickly filed a dispute, and was told it would take 10 business days to investigate.  And I‚Äôm not gonna lie at first I was like 10
Days!! That‚Äôs all my money in the world.. and what‚Äôs there to investigate.... so of course I got to googling other peoples experiences with Varo‚Äôs dispute resolution policies and i found quite a lot of people crying foul about investigations that did not go there way... and not getting any communication at all back.  I didn‚Äôt really find one positive account... I have to assume that just be because satisfied customers are less likely to leave a detailed review unsatisfied customers.

So I want to go on record and say that my expedited was 100% positive.. they did exactly what they said they would do, contacted when they said they would and promptly refunded my money at the end of the investigation.  Not a single complaint from me, and I thought about it and the few times I have had to contact
Customer support my issue has always been resolved to my satisfaction promptly... whether jt was mobile deposit limit increases, or over draft fee correction/reimbursement... always excellent... that‚Äôs all i guess... just felt
Like they deserved a positive accounting of they service out there for people to see.

title: Doing better
review:
Takes awhile to get customer service (90 minutes) and then it takes days three or four calls @90 minutes each to have them do something unusual like a wire transfer or increasing your transfer to an outside account limit, but now that that is done I‚Äôm very satisfied with the result.  Big takeaway:  NO FEES for any of this.  and that‚Äôs the Bottom line.  The bank I transferred funds to charged me $15 though.  

So:  
FEES:  A+
SERVICE: C
EASE of APP:  A+

There‚Äôs no substitute though for a teller when you need one, like to grt a cashiers check, though.  So you probably need a regular savings  account at a bricks and mortar bank.
developerResponse: {'id': 21634117, 'body': 'Thank you for providing your feedback. Our team is always working to implement new features and tools for our customers. We apologize for the hold times. Our team is working hard and efficiently to offer the best service possible. If you still require assistance, please send us an email at support@varomoney.com. ', 'modified': '2021-03-14T10:02:25Z'}

title: Use to love this bank
review: I currently have about 6.00 in my account not much I know,but I tried to make a 1.99 purchase and was declined. When my money hits my account I‚Äôll be moving it to chime. They have 100.00 overdraft protection and will hopefully let me use my own money!
developerResponse: {'id': 22164851, 'body': 'Hi! We would love the opportunity to look into your concern. As we were unable to locate an account with your Apple ID, kindly reach out at appreview@varomoney.com so that we may further assist you.', 'modified': '2021-04-10T19:55:15Z'}

title: Extremely angry customer
review: I have nothing but negative things to say about Varo Bank I would never recommend them to anyone. I would never want anyone to go through the experience I have. Not only did they lock up my PIN number for my card for no reason making it impossible to use at an atm but they stole $178.16 from me to be exact and when I tried contacting customer service 5 different times to try to get it resolved I waited over an hour one day it was over an hour and a half just to get hung up on and no one ever answers. Tried emailing to get this taken care of but never get any help that way either I guess I‚Äôm glad I waited to move my direct deposit to that bank because I definitely won‚Äôt be switching it to them now. Instead I‚Äôll be using something more trustworthy and filing a report with the better business bureau and to anyone else who‚Äôs had their money stolen by this bank I urge you to file a report too do not let them get away with this
developerResponse: {'id': 22126848, 'body': 'We‚Äôre very sorry for the long hold times recently. We‚Äôre currently experiencing extremely high volumes and completely understand your frustration. We understand the importance of contacting customer support and are eager to assist with your request. We appreciate your patience during this time. We want to take a look into your situation and better assist you, please reach out to us at appreview@varomoney.com, we hope to hear from you!\r\n', 'modified': '2021-04-08T13:43:37Z'}

title: Nonexistent customer service
review: My true rating is zero stars. I‚Äôm not able to link Varo with simple things such as Quickbooks and similar apps. To make matters worse service has become increasingly unsatisfactory during their transition period to become a charter bank.  Starting with them not syncing my new phone number to the card they sent and requesting I take pictures of my identification and a picture of me holding my identification which I‚Äôve never had to do with any online bank before and find pretty invasive a picture of my ID cool but a picture of me holding it strange. Especially for a phone number update. It would be loads easier to verify via email the same as every other bank I do business with including Capital One which is completely i line as well. Furthermore, Capital One has never made such requests when updating info or verifying if I‚Äôm the actual account holder. They call I answer security questions or they send an email with a code etc. After this confusion I decided to close my account and have reached out to them via phone MULTIPLE times but the wait time is over an hour and they don‚Äôt have a callback option. I‚Äôve emailed TWICE with no response regarding the process of closing my account. If they‚Äôre trying to become a serious competitor of online banks like Capital One they have a LONG way to go. Their customer service is nonexistent, they have ridiculously long wait times so no one can get assistance, they don‚Äôt answer emails, they request identification verification in an invasive manner unusual from an online bank in my experience. Sadly, I‚Äôm truly disappointed with my experience I was excited for their transition and now just want to replace them with another bank that has fewer loopholes and actionable customer service. And, if  upon reaching out to them again they fail to respond and close my account to report them to Consumer Finance for failure to comply to my requests to close my account. I have no negative balance and my account is in good standing. This delay in my request makes no sense and only looks bad for them. I‚Äôm keeping all correspondence and sending a final email and written letter stating my request. I do hope they their job and respectfully close my account in a timely manner.

title: Not so smooth of a switch
review:
So like a good amount of reviewers have stated the previous Varo money app was great.  Everything laid out in front of you, never had issues using it. 
Now everyone had been switch over to Varo bank. Where we got sent new debit cards and told to make sure we update all our payment info to the new card. 
     Ok so whatever nothing to hassling for me.  But now I try to make a mobile check deposit.  And it says I can't because its over my deposit limit. I'm trying to deposit my paycheck the same one I've been depositing for the past year everyweek.  So I call in multiple times on multiple days during different times and it's always been an hour more wait. I got through once when my wait time was 30 min. I talk to the rep and tell them my problem. I thought it would be an easy fix.  I give them my info and they pull up my account and go ok let me update your new account with your old acccounts information. I get put on hold and then I the rep tells me to fill out some form, take a picture of my id and check and send it to have my request for raising my deposit limit to be reviewed.  I remember going through this process when I first opened a Varo account.  I told the rep I wasn't a new account that I had recently switched but was told to go through the procedure if i wanted to raise my limit. 
   A Varo rep also got into contact with me regarding my issues.  I sent a reply and sent another one a week later after not hearing from them.  Still waiting

title: Rrrrrrreeeeeeeeeeeed
review: Cool app

title: A Selfie?! Really?!
review:
Why don't I just offer a full blown strip search for you - live on camera. Sheesh.

I have a feeling this initial application for a checking account is DOA ... but, for kicks and giggles,  let's see what happens.

For starters, I started my application on the web site and when it came time to enter my birthday the popup window would not properly display the dates - they were out of the frame of the popup window! I'm sorry, but, there is nothing more unprofessional than this kind of elementary nonsense with UI. Oh I'm sure it's somebody's fault ... Apple, Safari maybe - come on. So, because I was not allowed to just manually type in the information I was apparently born in 1902 ... or was it 1903. Obviously my birthday is not going to jive, and if I get a giant hassle over it ... well, like I said, DOA.

Fire the snotty nosed IT geeks and get some adults in your software development department, (and pay them handsomely), and stop wasting my time with this ... well, you fill in the blank. VARO, Simple, TAB, ALLY, et. al., please get real with quality UI development, and complete, well-backed banking services with NO flaws - yes you heard me correctly, no flaws. Why should I have to put up with this ridiculous nonsense so you can save a buck at my expense. As with all of these online banking services, there's so much potential, but it gets quickly buried the most ridiculous glitches and hickups.

If VARO and the others cannot get the job done, then please quit all together.

In short, fix - your - stuff.

UPDATE:
2/26/21
It's not going to be pretty.

Your apps are broken. My iPhone XS takes flawless pictures, my pictures are perfectly lit, I've worked in television studios for over 30 years, I know when things are well lit, yet your app says my ID pictures and selfie are not acceptable. So, I take my own pictures and attempt to use that function in the Varo app, literally nothing happens except that the app now takes me to a page where all of the pictures I've attempted to submit show up and the only option I have is to tap the "Acknowledge" button. And now I have to wait another 3-5 days to find out if I have to go through this again - which I'm pretty sure I will since the first time was perfect to begin with.

So, I continue to fight with this junk tech [VARO] in hopes that I might get a chance to actually use some of the promised features, which I'm already convinced are not going to deliver as promised because they will also be broken and, at best, only semi-functional. Wow.

In the meantime, my private personal information is floating around in VARO's clouds somewhere, never to be taken back again.

Here's question for VARO - Is VARO domestic to the USA, and if not, what is the country of origin?

PS
The latest update tries to make a big splash out of getting paid early - what a total word game. Instead of razzle dazzle, why don't you just make sure you get the features you already have to work reliably - just a novel thought.
